availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Cincinnati Law & Collection Office,
Established A. D. 1849
ROOM No. 9,
MASONIC TEMPLE.
Masonic Temple
THOMAS POWELL, Attorney at Law,
United States Commissioner Notary Public Commissioner for the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Kentucky, Indiana &c.
Master Commissioner of the Courts &c. &c.
Cincinnati, Ohio.
The State of Ohio
Hamilton County } Sct.

Be it remembered that on this 16th day of April A D 1863 personally appeared before me the subscriber a Notary Public in and for the said County and State, Thomas Powell Esqr who being duly sworn deposeth and saith that he will well and truly execute and perform ^all^ the duties of his office as Commissioner for the state of Kentucky according to Law, within the state of Ohio.
Sworn to before me and subscribed in my presence this 16th day of April A D 1863

Wm J. Coppack
Notary Public
Ham. Co. Ohio

Ohio
Oath of office
Thos Powell
Comr of Deeds
Filed April 7. 1863
